required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Implementation of Electronic Decision Aids for Genetic Testing in Inherited Cancer Syndromes
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Implementation of Electronic Decision Aids for Genetic Testing in Inherited Cancer Syndromes

brief_summary.textblock: An electronic decision aid will be used to assist individuals in choosing a multi-gene panel with their medical oncologist instead of a genetic counselor. A decision aid may facilitate quality decisions around the selection of a specific multi-gene panel without a genetic counselor. Upon completion of the decision aid, participants will be asked to indicate their decision about whether to pursue genetic testing and which specific multi-gene panel to pursue. A survey will then be administered to assess participants' opinions on the decision aid.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with how educational information is presented in the decision aid
primary_outcome.time_frame: This outcome will be measured immediately following completion of the decision aid
primary_outcome.description: Measured with 6 items on a questionnaire that asks participants to rate the way certain information is presented on the decision aid. Each item is rated on a scale of 1 to 4, with 1 being poor and 4 being excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total time spent on decision aid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of the decision aid to the completion of the decision aid
secondary_outcome.description: The total amount of minutes spent on the decision aid

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will complete an electronic decision aid for genetic testing.

intervention.description: The decision aid will be evaluated by a survey administered to those who have used the tool.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults (18 years of age or older)
- Diagnosed with malignant ovarian tumor or malignant pancreatic adenocarcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children (<18 years of age)
- Unable to complete surveys
- Previous germline genetic testing

responsible_party.investigator_title: Daniel C Chung, MD; Director, High-Risk GI Cancer Clinic
